text: Giuseppe Mifsud Bonnici (17 July 1930 – 21 February 2019) was a Maltese judge and philosopher. He was Chief Justice of Malta between 1990 and 1995. He worked in the philosophy of law.Mark Montebello, Il-Ktieb tal-Filosofija f’Malta (A Source Book of Philosophy in Malta), PIN Publications, Malta, 2001, Vol. II, p. 37. Bonnici was born in Cospicua, Malta. He was a member of the European Court of Human Rights from 1992 to 1998. Bonnici died on 21 February 2019 in Valletta, Malta from lung cancer, aged 88. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Judges of the European Court of Human Rights Category:Maltese writers Category:Chief Justices of Malta Category:Philosophers
title: Giuseppe Mifsud Bonnici
